data.text: Best Software for Long Distance Bike Route Planning (2000 mile+)?

What is the best software for route planning long distance (2000 mile+)? And what hardware works with it? Am looking to plan a tour through Europe, Middle East and beyond so need a something which is available worldwide Am Looking at getting the garmin edge or similar, does it only work with its own maps? Do you need a paid subscription to download maps? Is there some device I can buy one off and download all the maps I need on my dedicated navigating device for free? Something open source? Don't want to have to rely on phone but it's a handy back up Also need to be able to plan out on PC with maps showing elevation, points of interest and ideally a way of logging my own custom points and notes. What else is important that I've missed? Cheers guys üëç
Comot
data.author: Dragan Ognjanoviƒá

data.text:
https://brouter.de/brouter-web/#map=1/10/-17/standard

data.author: Denis Charbonneau

data.text: Mapy.cz and Maps.me both free and can navigate offline with previously downloaded maps
data.author: Denis Charbonneau

data.text: Been using it for months now. By far my fav.
data.author: McKenley Newman

data.text: i always use a compass
data.author: Richard Reitman

data.text: Komoot would in fact be my choice but even though my trips are in the 4 digit range, I would never plan the whole trip at once. Or maybe just to get a general overview, but I would never strictly stick to that.

data.author: Radus Ango

data.text: Cycle.travel (splitting the route into stages rather than one massive file) then loaded into my wahoo elemnt roam
data.author: Anwen Ashworth

data.text: Vague plan by looking at a map then use something like maps.me for your next day or so depending on what you might be doing for accommodation.
data.author: Richard Watson

data.text: I use komoot (try one region for free, then buy worldwide access) with Garmin Edge Explore (works with other Edge models too). It is possible to plan a long route, then - in Premium version - split it into daily stages. However, although I plan the overall route and keep it for reference, I replan daily routes from scratch on day-to-day basis, depending on where I am and how far I intend to go on the next day.
data.author: Marcin Kysiak

data.text: I just planned a month-long route UK route on Komoot. Found it to be really useful and easy to use. The function that let‚Äôs you see places to eat and stay, bike shops and points of interest along the route is really useful.
data.author: Scott Hyman

data.text: I use Kamoot, or google-maps. Compare, then print the map to use off-line. Thr paper map can be laminated or placed in a plastic bag to protect it.
data.author: Benjamin Moravec

data.text: There will be a lot of maps for an entire year
data.author: Dorothee Hildebrandt

data.text: yup make them as needed, then throw 'em away when you've cleared that area.
data.author: Benjamin Moravec

data.text: Google maps is OK, but hint is to look at street view overlay of blue routes, so you know a car has been able to pass through. Then choose smallest routes possible. Had too many times having to wade rivers and carry bike for long periods because google maps gave me impossible routes.
data.author: John Dingley

data.text: Try mapy.cz an app on the phone . Took us through Greece :)
data.author: Aneta Venn

data.text: Mapsme offline, Google Maps online.
data.author: Ignacio Duran

data.text: EasyRoute
data.author: Fred Rufener

data.text: Just planned 4000+ mile ride using Ride with GPS. Do need to break it up into roughly 300 mile segments to download and use properly on phone. Can also download to GPS. Included cues and POIs. Excellent customer support when you get stuck and need help. Uses heat maps also.
data.author: John Goldman

data.text: Premium cost money, mapy.cz is free of charge
data.author: Philipp Reinecke

data.text:
mapy.cz (free of charge and offline possible) for planning. Mapy.cz can also be downloaded on your mobile device (Android and iPhone) and is also offline usable. I can't recommend a GPS device, because they are all too expensive and eating batteries. https://mapy.cz

data.author: Philipp Reinecke
